answerText: spectrophotometry[10] Spectrophotometry is commonly used to measure this quantity of a solution. It is often expressed in molarity, and the absorbance divided by the product of extinction coefficient and path length gives it.
heading: Penn Bowl |2014 | 3 | 15 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The NanoDrop is an instrument used in this technique which eschews cuvettes in favor of pipetting a droplet of the solution directly onto a pedestal. For 10 points each: [10] Name this technique in which a solution's absorbance or transmittance at various wavelengths is measured. This technique is governed by the Beer-Lambert law.
